snippet: The successful sale of the Treasury Department's remaining stake in the American International Group means that taxpayers have gained about $22.7 billion from a bailout that many predicted would prompt a staggering loss.
abstract: The successful sale of the Treasury Department's remaining stake in the American International Group means that taxpayers have gained about $22.7 billion from a bailout that many predicted would prompt a staggering loss.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: Treasury Earns $7.6 Billion From Sale of Last Shares in A.I.G.
